Sentencas: An energy conversion and management concept for a combined system of a solid oxide fuel cell coupled with a fuel reforming device is developed and analyzed by a thermodynamic and electrochemical model.
Titulo: Design and optimization of a combined fuel reforming and solid oxide fuel cell system with anode off-gas recycling

Sentencas: The model is verified by an experiment and then used to evaluate the overall system performance and to further suggest an optimal design strategy.
Titulo: Design and optimization of a combined fuel reforming and solid oxide fuel cell system with anode off-gas recycling

Sentencas: The unique feature of the system is the inclusion of the anode off-gas recycle that eliminates the need of external water consumption for practical applications.
Titulo: Design and optimization of a combined fuel reforming and solid oxide fuel cell system with anode off-gas recycling

Sentencas: The system performance is evaluated as a function of the steam to carbon ratio, fuel cell temperature, anode off gas recycle ratio and CO2 adsorption percentage.
Titulo: Design and optimization of a combined fuel reforming and solid oxide fuel cell system with anode off-gas recycling

Sentencas: For most of the operating conditions investigated, the system efficiency starts at around 70% and then monotonically decreases to the average of 50% at the peak power density before dropping down to zero at the limiting current density point.
Titulo: Design and optimization of a combined fuel reforming and solid oxide fuel cell system with anode off-gas recycling

Sentencas: From an engineering application point of view, the proposed combined fuel reforming and SOFC system with a range of efficiency between 50% and 70% is considered very attractive.
Titulo: Design and optimization of a combined fuel reforming and solid oxide fuel cell system with anode off-gas recycling

Sentencas: It is suggested that the optimal system is the one where the SOFC operates around 900 degrees C with S/C ratio higher than 3, maximum CO2 capture, and minimum AOG recirculation.
Titulo: Design and optimization of a combined fuel reforming and solid oxide fuel cell system with anode off-gas recycling
